executive_summary: Mail-order retailers are companies that primarily use mail catalogs and TV to display and sell merchandise. Rapidly increasing competition from online shopping outlets forced mail-order retailers to develop new strategies to prevent revenue losses or slow growth. E-commerce retailers offer levels of convenience that are highly attractive to consumers, lowering sales from mail order services, particularly among younger consumers. However, the industry benefited from the pandemic, as older consumers were encouraged to reduce exposure to the virus and stay at home. Revenue for mail-order businesses is expected to climb at a CAGR of 4.3% to $252.3 billion through the end of 2024, despite a forecast decline of 2.1% in 2024.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Fluctuations in Consumer Spending Influences Sales
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Mail-order products are discretionary in nature, making them susceptible to changes in spending habits. The 2020 pandemic resulted in higher disposable income levels because of reduced expenses from other areas, like gas and entertainment. Stimulus programs also pushed up disposable income levels. Increasing disposable income boosted demand for mail-order products as social distancing regulations prevented consumers from going to traditional stores. Revenue grew by more than 8.0% each year between 2020 and 2022.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: E-COMMERCE GROWTH THREATENS MAIL ORDER RETAILERS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Recent inflation and interest rate increases have caused disposable income and consumer spending growth to slow down, reducing demand for mail-order services. Also, rising competition from online retailers has siphoned away revenue and pressured profit. Over the past two decades, e-commerce has exhibited tremendous growth, lowering the need for traditional and mail order retailers. Online shopping revolutionized how consumers shop, as people now have more access to product information, including learning about other buyers' experiences with specific products and comparing prices across retailers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: In recent years, the Federal Reserve has increased the federal funds rate to combat high inflation. A climb in the federal funds rate signals less liquidity in the market and corresponds to less economic activity. Higher interest rates have spurred fears about a recession and a sizeable slide in the consumer confidence index. While consumer confidence will improve in the coming years, the consumer confidence index is expected to remain below pre-pandemic levels through the end of 2029.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: E-commerce Will Continue to Gain Strength
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: E-commerce will continue to pose a threat to mail-order retailers as consumers become more comfortable shopping online. Younger generations have grown up with e-commerce. Online shopping platforms often have a broader product selection, a trend that will continue over the coming years. This allows online retailers to meet the needs of a wider customer pool.

Traditional retail stores seek to modernize physical stores, while e-commerce companies turn to brick-and-mortar stores to earn supplemental revenue. Foot traffic at physical stores waned amid the pandemic but most consumers have returned to shopping in stores. These stores aim to improve the shopping experience for consumers and make in-store shopping more convenient.

As consumers become more health-conscious, sales of products and services that promote health and well-being will be boosted. Mail-order retailers that are able to offer a wide range of health and wellness products, along with personalized advice and recommendations, will be able to carve out a niche.

industry_definition: The Mail Order industry is composed of companies that primarily use mail catalogs or TV to attract clients and display merchandise. This industry does not include operators that generate sales through door-to-door marketing, brick-and-mortar retail or e-commerce.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - steady

key_trends: Mail order retailers face increasing external competition. The growth of e-commerce solutions and the comeback of brick-and-mortar stores will place pressure on mail-order retailers.
Retailers with a positive reputation attract more customers. Delivering orders in a timely manner improves brand positioning within the industry, driving sales.
Competition from e-commerce continues to grow. Mail order companies have resorted to building their own websites to diversify revenue streams.
Stream services limit exposure to TV networks, lowering revenue from this source. This comes as many households switched their cable TV subscriptions for video streaming services.
Major companies engage in partnerships to strengthen exposure. Working with public figures is common among companies looking to reach new customers.
Cigna changes its branding to represent other brands operating under its umbrella. The healthcare company will begin to circulate new branding across all products.

Growing e-commerce sales lowers mail-order sales. E-commerce solutions offer convenient features that improve the customer experience. Consumers have become more comfortable with online shopping in recent years.
Changes in tax collection laws push up operating costs. Retailers will now be required to pay internet sale taxes, which they were previously not required to do.
Retailers implement automation systems to lower costs. However, the industry continues to rely heavily on workers for order fulfillment.

market_segmentation.segment: The Older Generations Are Wary of Change
market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers aged 55 and older have switched to online shopping, similar to other demographics. However, older shoppers are less likely to fully adopt e-commerce solutions. Dependence on medication among the elderly stimulates sales for mail-order services.

market_segmentation.segment: Middle Age Consumers Shop Across Retailers
market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers within this age group use mail-order retailers because of the convenience of buying items from catalogs and TV shopping networks. Mail-order retailers have struggled to win business from middle-aged consumers as the convenience of e-commerce trumps that of mail orders.

market_segmentation.segment: Younger Generations Are Very Familiar With E-Commerce Solutions
market_segmentation.segment_description: Consumers under age 34 have had access to technology their whole lives, making them trust e-commerce retailers. Similarly to older consumers, people within this age group aim to improve their shopping experience. Access to more product information and tracking the status of their orders are major selling points for younger consumers.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Demand for Other Products Falls Amid Higher Spending on Health
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Mail-order retailers offer a wide range of products and services, including cigars, hearing aids, sewing goods, books, tools, flowers, food, beverages and other items. The sale of other products has diminished in recent years, as sales of health and beauty products expanded.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: The Popularity of Online Shopping Continues to Grow
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The popularity of online shopping continues to grow as consumers consider it safe and reliable, threatening mail order retailers. Compared with traditional catalogs, internet retail offers quicker transactions, greater price-based competition among retailers and more thorough customer reviews. Online transactions are almost immediate, increasing convenience. Increases in e-commerce sales can lead to lower sales for this industry.

business_locations.location_description: The industry, by nature, relies on reaching a broad group of people to increase exposure and maximize sales. The Southeast is the most populated region in the country, making it ideal for retailers looking to reach a broader market. Highly-populated urban areas like New York City are ideal for mail order retailers. Many consumers in these cities don't have cars to transport larger pieces, including furniture.

business_locations.location: Access to Major Ports Lowers Operating Costs
business_locations.location_description: Retailers import many of their products to keep purchasing costs low. Proximity to major trade ports lowers transportation costs, as retailers are relatively closer to manufacturers. Although exports are not accounted for in domestic revenue, some retailers sell products overseas. Easy access to ports simplifies the shipping process, benefiting retailers. The West, Southeast and Mid-Atlantic are near major trading ports.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Streamlined Sales and Use Tax Agreement
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Streamlined Sales Tax Governing Board seeks to minimize the costs and administrative burden on retailers that collect sales tax across multiple states. The agreement focuses on simplifying sales and use tax collection and administration by retailers and states.

In June 2018, the Supreme Court ruled that states' collecting internet sales tax legal, overturning a 1992 ruling that only permitted collection if the business has a physical presence in the state where consumers purchase products.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Mail, Internet or Telephone Order Merchandise Rule
regulations_points.regulation_description: Mail order retailers are also governed by the Federal Trade Commission's Mail or Telephone Order Merchandise rule, which requires that retailers use methods that enable the shipment of goods within 30 days of a product's order.

The Federal Trade Commission FTC controls privacy laws and restrictions regarding collecting and using certain personal information, including information from medical facilities, driver's licenses, automotive registration and purchases without prior consent.
Pharmaceutical mail-order retailers are subject to stricter licensing regulations and certification by the National Association of Boards of Pharmacy (NABP).

basis_points.basis_description: Mail-order retailers face increasing external competition. The growth of e-commerce solutions and the comeback of brick-and-mortar stores will place pressure on mail-order retailers.
Retailers with a positive reputation attract more customers. Delivering orders in a timely manner improves brand positioning within the industry, driving sales.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Companies specializing in specific markets will gain higher market share, as competition is limited. Other product segments are highly fragmented, preventing smaller retailers from securing a sizeable share of revenue.

concentration_points.concentration_title: High Levels of Consolidation Increase Market Share
concentration_points.concentration_description: A growing number of retailers have resorted to participating in brick-and-mortar, online and other forms of retailing as mail orders fall in popularity. Some retailers have fully switched strategies, leaving mail-order retailing and joining other, more profitable, retailing methods. Large mail-order retailers commonly acquire smaller companies, increasing their market share and operating capabilities.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchase Costs Increase Amid Supply Chain Disruptions
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs account for retailers' most considerable expense, as retailers resell products from manufacturers and wholesalers. A stronger US dollar benefits retailers by making purchases of foreign products more affordable for US-based retailers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Implementing Automated Systems Lowers Wage Expenses
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: In response to the absence of retail locations, employee costs are relatively low for retailers compared with other brick-and-mortar retailers. Employees conduct administrative tasks, fulfill merchandise orders placed and provide customer service, including taking phone orders, answering customer queries and handling merchandise returns.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The lack of physical locations leads to a lower level of capital intensity. Retailers spend money on items like computers, warehouse shipping equipment and other material goods, a typical expense across all types of retailers.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Changes in Consumer Behavior Constrain Mail Order Sales
volatility_points.volatility_description: A growing number of consumers prefer to do their shopping online. Online shopping is often more convenient and gives shoppers the ability to easily compare prices.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Supply Chain Disruptions Influence Product Availability
volatility_points.volatility_description: The 2020 pandemic resulted in significant supply chain disruptions, lowering the supply of products. Issues with the supply chain affected many mail-order retailers' ability to maintain inventory, increasing waiting times and pushing some consumers toward large traditional retailers.

High disposable income levels during the pandemic resulted in elevated discretionary spending, boosting mail-order sales. Recent elevated inflation and growing interest rates have lowered consumer sentiment, pushing down the sale of discretionary products.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: The Implementation of Diversified Marketing Strategies
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Mail-order retailers are looking to adapt to the growing demand for e-commerce services as consumer behavior is shifting to favor e-commerce retailers. In addition to sending over catalogs and other printed media, mail-order retailers began offering products through their own websites, diversifying revenue streams.

FAQs.question: What are the key regulations for pharmaceutical mail order retailers?
FAQs.answer: Pharmaceutical mail-order retailers are subject to stricter licensing regulations and certification by the National Association of Boards of Pharmacy (NABP). To meet VIPPS certification standards, pharmacies must comply with the licensing regulations of the home state and the states to which they dispense medications.

FAQs.question: What industry assistance is available for mail order retailers?
FAQs.answer: The American Catalog Mailers Association is the only industry association that advocates exclusively for mail-order retailers on matters including postal service regulations, environmental issues, and congressional relations. The National Retail Federation is the world's largest retail trade association that also supports mail-order retailers.

FAQs.question: How has the growth of online sales affected mail order businesses?
FAQs.answer: The mail order industry has been tremendously affected by the rise of the internet, especially e-commerce. E-commerce shops have taken significant market share from the industry, but the shift to online TV has also impacted companies in the form of smaller customer bases.

FAQs.question: Are mail order sales dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: The retail sector as a whole, including mail order, is generally reliant on the overall health of the US economy. Mail order customers tend to be older, so any drastic shift in the stock market may cause them to hold back on spending.

FAQs.question: Do mail order companies lease equipment to reduce costs?
FAQs.answer: Companies should look to make investment in warehouse equipment and technology to increase operational productivity and efficiency. Leasing equipment may also lead to less depreciation costs.

FAQs.question: Have rising input costs affected mail order sales?
FAQs.answer: Lower oil prices and the strong US dollar has made mail order operations more affordable. Purchases remain the largest expense for retailers, but the strengthening US dollar has made foreign purchases more affordable.

FAQs.question: How has automation affected wage costs for mail order companies?
FAQs.answer: Automation is hugely important in fulfillment; using robotic technology, orders can be fulfilled and sent out for delivery more efficiently. While large companies invest in robotic technology, small operators can partner with third-party logistics companies to reduce wage costs through automation.

FAQs.question: Do mail order companies use point-of-sale systems for inventory management?
FAQs.answer: Mail order businesses should be aware of new POS technologies, including blockchain technology, that can improve inventory operations. Companies should also collect and analyze selling data to better understand how to order inventory.

FAQs.question: Have any regulatory expenses affected mail order profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: Many states have enacted e-commerce tax laws in recent years, which puts e-commerce retailers on a more level playing field with mail order retailers. As a result, the mail order industry could benefit slightly as the price difference between the two shopping methods narrows.

FAQs.question: How do mail order companies ensure compliance with EPA hazardous material regulations?
FAQs.answer: Companies that operate warehouses may be targets of strict regulation to ensure the safety of their employees and the environment. Companies should consult state and local officials to ensure all regulatory requirements are met.

FAQs.question: Do mail order companies face challenges with customer payments?
FAQs.answer: Mail order shopping is overwhelmingly B2C, so companies should not face challenges having customers pay on time.

FAQs.question: What ongoing financing challenges do mail order companies experience?
FAQs.answer: Companies should look to leasing equipment and warehouse space if financing proves challenging.

FAQs.question: How do mail order companies adopt new technology?
FAQs.answer: Mail order businesses that embrace new technologies are able to analyze consumer preferences and provide order-tracking services to better compete. Enterprise resource planning (ERP) software has accelerated automation and reduced human error. Implementing new technology can have high upfront costs but often reduces wage costs and increases efficiency.

FAQs.question: How do mail order companies maintain optimum stock levels?
FAQs.answer: By implementing stock controls, companies ensure that popular items are available for sale to increase revenue and reduce inventory carrying costs. ERP software may help maintain optimum stock levels. Maintaining optimum stock levels contributes to the company's reputation.

FAQs.question: How important is product presentation for mail order catalogs?
FAQs.answer: Providing engaging and informative catalog material is essential to drive sales since products are not physically available for consumers to inspect prior to purchase. Catalog presentation can be seen as a form of advertising.

FAQs.question: How have mail order companies responded to e-commerce competition?
FAQs.answer: The internet continues to become increasingly accepted as a safe and reliable method for purchasing goods, which threatens growth for mail order companies. Methods to better compete include improving catalog presentation and adopting new technologies.

FAQs.question: How does disposable income affect demand for mail order products?
FAQs.answer: Goods sold by mail order businesses are discretionary in nature. Shifts in demand typically correspond with changes in disposable income. Companies may need to stimulate demand when disposable income levels are low.

FAQs.question: Do mail order companies have business customers that make bulk purchases?
FAQs.answer: Businesses, which often purchase items in bulk, make up a key (though small) market for the mail order industry; it is more convenient to order products via mail order catalog than from brick-and-mortar stores.
